content.description: Enter wide crack using some of those hard earned wide crack climbing skills or climb the nice edges to the left to a spacious ledge.  May feel like a 5.8 or 5.10 depending on the level of bee's one can endure.  Bee careful beecause bumping bee's leads to bitting (stinging) bee's...bee warned.  From ledge continue in perfect crack to summit.
content.location: The route a few feet right of Blue Highways or ten feet right of beehive.

climbs.name: Blue Highways
climbs.fa: B. Hatcher, J. Waugh, F. Valendo

content.description: A wonderful gem with ample protection big and small.  Wiggle up/behind flake, quick mantle to engage thin crack and enjoy quality jams and edges to the summit.  A beautiful zenolith keeps things civilized; you will know when you get to it...
content.location: Locate large beehive in the ground and at base of formation.  Whisper, tip-toe and pretend you don't hear the buzz or see the thousands of bees near your feet, hips and head.  Route begins 7 feet right of hive.

content.description: East facing mini-wall with two quality routes and one large beehive.
